basics.name: Gregorio Marchesini
basics.label: PhD Candidate In Decision and Control Systems Theory
basics.summary: I am a PhD candidate in Decision and Control Systems Theory at KTH Royal Institute of Technology, Stockholm, Sweden. My research interests include Optimization, Predictive Control, Multi-Agent Systems and Formal Methods.

work.name: C.I.R.I Aerospace, Forli, Italy
work.summary: The research project focused on the evaluation of the Wavelet Decomposition method as possible tool for recovering temporal doppler shift information for Deep Space communication operations.

work.name: KTH, Department of Space and Plasma Physics
work.summary: Analysis of the Lyman Alpha radiation features from the Jovian moon Ganymede, Neptune and Uranous. The analysis aimed at detecting possible radiation anomalies related to water plumes escaping from Ganymede. I worked under the supervision of professor Lorenz Roth.

work.name: MIST-MIniature Student saTellite
work.summary: As AOCS engineer in the project, I analysed compared and implemented different calibration algorithms as possible solutions for the MIST's on-board magnetometer calibration.

volunteer.summary: Lead organizer of events, research project presentantions and social media management for Euroavia. The aim of Euroavia is grow a strong community of young researchers and leaders in the Aerospace Industry.
